intro: Campanula erinoides, commonly known as the bellflower or Erinoides bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula erinoides is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
